title: Identifying the Scene
content: I'm currently focused on breaking down the image. My first step is to scrutinize the visual elements – architecture, signage, and anything else that could pinpoint the setting. From there, I will develop preliminary location ideas to explore.

title: Deconstructing the Image
content: I've zeroed in on the station's signage, specifically "GARE" and the SNCF logo. The "GARE DE" text is partially obscured, but I think I can discern "CE" or "ICE" after "DE". My immediate thoughts are to consider Gare de l'Est, or Gare d'Austerlitz in Paris. Let me check these out and eliminate or confirm these guesses.

title: Deciphering the Signage
content: I'm delving deeper into the obscured signage. I've identified "GARE DE" and the SNCF logo, confirming a French location. After zooming in, I now believe the station is "GARE DE NICE-VILLE" given the letters I see. The tricolor flag and architecture further reinforce this. Now, I'll verify this hypothesis.

title: Testing Hypotheses
content: I've formulated a strong hypothesis: the station is Gare de Nice-Ville, France. To confirm, I'm now comparing the image against known photos of Nice-Ville station. I will check the architecture, signage, and overall layout. I'm cross-referencing multiple online sources to verify my findings.

title: Refining the Location
content: I've confirmed Gare de Nice-Ville. Now I'm zoning in on the neighborhood. The station sits on Avenue Thiers, so I'm going with the **Thiers** neighborhood as the primary answer, though it's linked to the broader "Jean-Médecin" area. The location's narrowed, and I'm almost ready.

title: Identifying Key Landmarks
content: I'm now checking for cross-references on the station. I've determined the neighborhood name and the key street the station is located on.  I've also confirmed the broader geographical area and continent. The answer is complete.

title: Confirming and Formatting
content: I've reviewed the available information and determined the location is "Avenue Thiers, Nice, France, Europe" to meet the format requirements. I'm confident in this.

title: Concluding the Analysis
content: I've analyzed the image and confirmed the location. The visual cues, especially the "GARE" and "SNCF" logo, pointed me to France, and the architecture hinted at Nice. I then confirmed the location as Gare de Nice-Ville. Finally, I formatted the answer using the street address to match the example, settling on "Avenue Thiers, Nice, France, Europe."
